intro: Valeriana variabilis, commonly known as variable valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their sedative properties. Valeriana variabilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in woodland edges and meadows.
